United States.description: US websites must meet ADA requirements. Federal agencies and contractors must comply with Section 508, which references WCAG 2.0 AA. ADA enforcement often points to WCAG 2.1 AA as best practice.

United Kingdom.description: Websites must be accessible under the Equality Act. UK government guidance aligns with WCAG 2.1 AA.

European Union.description: The EAA applies to digital services across the EU. It is implemented via EN 301 549, which aligns with WCAG 2.1 AA.

Canada (Ontario).description: Ontario requires websites to meet WCAG 2.0 AA. Enforcement applies to businesses with 50+ employees.

Australia.description: The DDA requires accessible websites. Australian courts reference WCAG 2.1 AA as the benchmark.
